chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
All charges against Andrew C Sanders in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andrew C Sanders is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew C Sanders

records.addlTxt: by Attorney Brett Copeland, filed.

Defendant Andrew C Sanders in court.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Andrew C Sanders.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to DISMISS is granted by the Court WITHOUT PREJUDICE.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-12-22, filed.

Defendant Andrew C Sanders in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 09/12/2022 at 8:30 am, with the understanding that it may be resolving on that date. Case adjourned to Branch 29.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-10-22

Defendant Andrew C Sanders in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a plea and sentencing hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7-8-22, filed.

Defendant Andrew C Sanders in court with attorney Jade Hall for Brett Lee Copeland.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-19-22, filed.

Defendant Andrew C Sanders in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Alfred Hermann - MPD Police Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4-19-22, filed.

Defendant Andrew C Sanders in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel requests a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 3-10-22, filed.
received and filed.

Defendant Andrew C Sanders in court.  Mario Fiumefreddo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. The PD's Office needs more time to appoint counsel. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 2-16-22, filed.

Court ordered no contact with CMW (DOB 10/23/88)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Andrew C Sanders in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Andrew C Sanders in custody.  Student Intern Kathleen Kruse under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Andrew C Sanders appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 1. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
